credit.credit-words: Music: Lewis Edson, 1762 Text: Isaac Watts, 1707
3. He lives! He lives and sits above, Forever interceding there:

Who shall divide us from His love, Or what shall tempt us to despair?
4. Shall persecution, or distress, Famine, or sword, or nakedness?
He who hath loved us bears us through, And makes us more than conqu’rors too.

Faith hath an overcoming pow’r, It triumphs in the dying hour: Christ is our life, our joy, our hope, Nor can we sink with such a prop.
6.
Not all that men on earth can do, Nor pow’rs on high, nor pow’rs below, Shall cause His mercy to remove, Or wean our hearts from Christ our love.
